channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: More than 100 Palestinians are killed in Gaza in a day of Israeli airstrikes
item.description: It has been a deadly week of Israeli airstrikes in Gaza.
item.content:encoded:
It has been a deadly week of Israeli airstrikes in Gaza.

(Image credit: Bashar Taleb)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Kahn

item.title: DOJ may drop case against Boeing over deadly 737 Max crashes, despite families' outrage
item.description: Boeing agreed last year to plead guilty to defrauding regulators after the crashes of two 737 Max jets, in 2018 and 2019, that killed 346 people. But a federal judge rejected that proposed plea deal.
item.content:encoded:
Boeing agreed last year to plead guilty to defrauding regulators after the crashes of two 737 Max jets, in 2018 and 2019, that killed 346 people. But a federal judge rejected that proposed plea deal.

(Image credit: Shelby Tauber)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: ICC chief prosecutor Karim Khan is on leave amid a sexual misconduct investigation
item.description: Facing allegations of sexual misconduct, Karim Khan has temporarily stepped aside as a U.N. investigation enters its final stage, the International Criminal Court announced Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Facing allegations of sexual misconduct, Karim Khan has temporarily stepped aside as a U.N. investigation enters its final stage, the International Criminal Court announced Friday.

(Image credit: Michael M. Santiago)
item.dc:creator: Majd Al-Waheidi

item.title: Connecting the dots on DOGE
item.description:
It's been six months since President Trump first announced the creation of the Department of Government Efficiency initiative, which has dramatically shrunk parts of the federal government. And with so many individual stories about federal workers losing their jobs around the country, the big picture can sometimes look blurry.

A team of NPR reporters has been looking at agencies — from food inspectors to nuclear scientists to firefighters and more — and today, we'll connect some of the dots on how DOGE cuts have impacted workers, and hear how Americans far beyond Washington may feel the effects of these cuts.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.
item.content:encoded:
It's been six months since President Trump first announced the creation of the Department of Government Efficiency initiative, which has dramatically shrunk parts of the federal government. And with so many individual stories about federal workers losing their jobs around the country, the big picture can sometimes look blurry.

A team of NPR reporters has been looking at agencies — from food inspectors to nuclear scientists to firefighters and more — and today, we'll connect some of the dots on how DOGE cuts have impacted workers, and hear how Americans far beyond Washington may feel the effects of these cuts.

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)

item.title: Supreme Court extends pause on deportations under Alien Enemies Act in Texas
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deporting a group of immigrants in northern Texas under the Alien Enemies Act. It said it's not directly addressing whether the invocation of the act was legal.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. Supreme Court temporarily blocked the Trump administration from deporting a group of immigrants in northern Texas under the Alien Enemies Act. It said it's not directly addressing whether the invocation of the act was legal.

(Image credit: Brandon Bell)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: DOGE tried assigning a team to the Government Accountability Office. It refused
item.description: An attempt by DOGE to assign a team to the independent Government Accountability Office was rejected Friday. The GAO is part of the legislative branch and not subject to DOGE's request.
item.content:encoded:
An attempt by DOGE to assign a team to the independent Government Accountability Office was rejected Friday. The GAO is part of the legislative branch and not subject to DOGE's request.

(Image credit: Bonnie Cash)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Diddy's lawyers plan to argue "mutual violence." Will that strategy work?
item.description: "Mutual abuse" is a term you may have heard in celebrity abuse trials - here's how to make sense of it.
item.content:encoded:
"Mutual abuse" is a term you may have heard in celebrity abuse trials - here's how to make sense of it.

(Image credit: Dia Dipasupil)
item.dc:creator: Liam McBain

item.title: Here are 5 takeaways from Trump's first major foreign trip to the Middle East
item.description: President Trump was greeted like royalty during his four-day trip to the Middle East, his first major foreign trip of this second term, where it was all about business deals and not moral leadership.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump was greeted like royalty during his four-day trip to the Middle East, his first major foreign trip of this second term, where it was all about business deals and not moral leadership.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Domenico Montanaro

item.title: James Comey is under investigation for his '8647' Instagram post. What does it mean?
item.description: The former FBI director posted — then deleted — a picture of seashells forming "8647." Trump and his allies view it as a call for his assassination, but Comey says he was unaware of that meaning.
item.content:encoded:
The former FBI director posted — then deleted — a picture of seashells forming "8647." Trump and his allies view it as a call for his assassination, but Comey says he was unaware of that meaning.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Labor watchdog opens investigation into DOGE whistleblower claims after NPR reporting
item.description: DOGE employees demanded the highest level of access to the labor agency's systems, according to a whistleblower and reporting from NPR. The whistleblower said sensitive data then left the agency.
item.content:encoded:
DOGE employees demanded the highest level of access to the labor agency's systems, according to a whistleblower and reporting from NPR. The whistleblower said sensitive data then left the agency.

(Image credit: Grace Raver)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler
